summary: Email correspondence between FBI Legal Attaché in London and others regarding the UK Financial Conduct Authority's investigation into Barclays CEO James Staley's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The FCA is investigating Staley's fitness for duty and seeking information about his connections to Epstein, having been put in contact with a source by the SDNY AUSA.

persons.name: James Staley
persons.context: Subject of FCA investigation regarding his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and fitness to serve as CEO. Claims relationship ended in 2015.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure whose relationship with James Staley is under investigation by the FCA regarding Staley's fitness for duty.

persons.name: Assistant Legal Attaché FBI/Legal Attaché London
persons.context: Primary recipient/author of emails, coordinating with FCA regarding their investigation into Staley-Epstein links and managing information sharing.

persons.name: AUSA in SDNY
persons.context: Previously contacted by FCA regarding Staley-Epstein investigation; declined to provide information but connected FCA to a source.

persons.name: FCA Team Leader/Intelligence Enforcement & Market Oversight Division
persons.context: Author of detailed email outlining FCA investigation into James Staley, seeking FBI assistance in gathering information about Staley-Epstein relationship.

connections.description: Personal relationship under investigation by FCA; Staley claims it ended in 2015 before he became Barclays CEO.
AUSA connected FCA to a source providing additional links between Staley and Epstein after declining to add to investigation.
Corresponding about FCA investigation into Staley-Epstein relationship and potential FBI assistance.

events.title: FCA opens investigation into James Staley
events.description: UK Financial Conduct Authority opens regulatory investigation into James Staley regarding his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and fitness to serve as Barclays CEO.

events.title: FCA questions Barclays about Staley-Epstein relationship
events.description: FCA asks Barclays senior management to consider what they've done to satisfy themselves about any relationship between the bank/Staley and Epstein.

events.title: Barclays responds to FCA inquiry
events.description: Barclays tells FCA that Staley confirmed he did not have a close relationship with Epstein and didn't see anything suggesting Epstein's alleged misconduct.

events.title: FCA-FBI correspondence about Staley investigation
events.description: FCA contacts FBI Legal Attaché in London seeking information about Staley-Epstein relationship for their regulatory investigation.

keyFacts: The UK Financial Conduct Authority is investigating Barclays CEO James Staley's fitness for duty based on his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
Staley claims his relationship with Epstein ended in 2015, before he became Barclays CEO, and that he didn't see anything suggesting Epstein's misconduct.
The SDNY AUSA declined to assist the FCA investigation but connected them to a source who provided additional links between Staley and Epstein.
The FCA is specifically seeking information about whether Staley and Epstein had a close personal relationship and whether Staley was aware of Epstein's alleged misconduct.
The FBI Legal Attaché in London is managing expectations that the FBI likely has nothing to provide for the FCA's regulatory investigation.
